variants.Description in input context: G2019S mutation in LRRK2 associated with increased kinase activity

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells overexpressing LRRK2-G2019S mutant were used in kinase assays.

Readout description.Result Description: LRRK2-G2019S showed 2.5-fold increased kinase activity compared to wild-type LRRK2.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were conducted.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was repeated three times technically.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells served as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used for comparison between groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Kinase activity within 1.5-fold of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Kinase activity exceeding 2-fold of wild-type levels.

Material used.Description: SH-SY5Y cells expressing LRRK2-G2019S were analyzed via Western blot.

Readout description.Result Description: LRRK2-G2019S showed increased phosphorylation of downstream substrates (e.g., Rab10) compared to wild-type.

Technical replicates.Description: Each blot was run in duplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2-expressing cells were used as positive controls.

Basic negative control.Description: Cells without LRRK2 overexpression served as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Dunnett's test was used for multiple comparisons.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Phosphorylation levels within 1.2-fold of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Phosphorylation levels exceeding 1.8-fold of wild-type levels.
